div.p: On the Eleventh of January the Shakespeare Club met at Miss Gove's for the purpose of Reading The Merchant of Venice.
The President called the Club to order at 7.15. The roll call was given & all members being present & answering with quotations from the above mentioned play.

After the roll call the minutes of the meeting of Jan. 4th were read & approved- Mrs. Ames there ?from? ?gift? ?are? the ??? use of several ?words? that had been discussed at the meeting of the !4th! after which they one hour was spent in discussing [illegible!] [illegible] from the ?guidance!? [illegible]â€”which the President read.

At 8 o'clock- began reading The Merchant of Venice- ?all? reading through two scenes of the third !act! act. [Illegible] there being ?few? [illegible] at which time the [illegible] adjourned to meet on Monday the 18th, 1897, the place of meeting being Mrs. Wylde's at which ?time? The Merchant of Venice is to be finished and a part of Romeo & Juliet which had been cast by Mrs. Wylde with cast as follows-
